Between 5% and 51% of short-term travelers take part in casual sex while abroad, with higher rates reported in long-term travelers.
27 Many STIs present as a febrile illness, including HIV seroconversion, secondary syphilis ( Fig. 150.3 ), and gonorrhea. People living with HIV who travel to the tropics can be at increased risk of opportunistic infections (see Table 150.1).
